items.title: Remixing a new way to build full-stack JavaScript apps
items.content:
#â€‹566 â€” November 26, 2021

UnsubscribeÂ Â |Â Â Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

Remix: A Newly Open Sourced React-Based Framework for WebÂ Apps â€” Remix has been around for over a year as â€˜sponsorwareâ€™ but after picking up a lot of ardent supporters (and $3m of seed funding) the project has now been opened up. Bringing modern Web tech, tooling, and server-side rendering concepts together, there are a few things to check out if you're keen to learn more:

  • The project's official â–¶ï¸ 50 second Apple-esque commercial/pitch.
  • â–¶ï¸ Kent C Dodd's multi-hour tutorial walkthrough. Almost a 'course' inÂ scope.
  • An introduction to building a Remix app with Flavio Copes.
  • A â–¶ï¸ seven minute review with Ahmad Awais.
  • Want to play? You can get building a Remix app right away thanks to StackBlitz's WebContainers at remix.new.

Remix Team

New Course: Introduction to Next.js, The Full-Stack React Framework â€” Next.js is a complete framework built on top of React.js. You'll learn server-side rendering, static site generation, data fetching, code API endpoints, creating pages with the file system, add CSS modules, andÂ more.

Frontend Masters sponsor

Vercel, Creator of Next.js, Raises $150M â€” Thereâ€™s a lot of money in developer tooling lately, it seems, including for the stewards of the Next.js project which gains a fresh competitor, of sorts, this week in the shape of Remix (above).

Vercel

Prettier 2.5 Released: Now with TypeScript 4.5 and MDX v2 Support â€” If youâ€™re a TypeScript user, this bump to the popular code formatting tool will be of particular interest toÂ you.

Sosuke Suzuki

IN BRIEF:

  • Why does npm run an obfuscated file that looks like malware, but isn't? It's a birthday related easter egg.

  • Not JS specific but AWS has just made a big change to its 'free tier' that might save many of us low-end users several bucks each month.

RELEASES:

Chalk 5.0 â€“ Terminal string styling for Node.js.
ShareDB 2.2 â€“ Realtime database based on operational transformation.
Signature Pad 4.0 â€“ Canvas control for drawing signatures.
node-qrcode 1.5 â€“ Generate QR codes in Node apps.
ESLint 8.3.0 â€“ Flexible code auditing tool.
Espree 9.1 â€“ Esprima-compatible JS parser.
React Redux v8 Beta

ğŸ’» Jobs

Senior JavaScript Developer (Fullstack) â€” Weâ€™re looking for a senior full-stack developer to help us build a high performance, high accuracy online fraud preventionÂ service.
FingerprintJS

Senior Mobile Developer (React Native/Node) â€“ Remote â€” Join Sippdâ€¤com, the Forbes Next1000 startup changing how users find and buy alcohol with AI & computer vision. Weâ€™re looking for a generalist that loves growth hacking and taking bigÂ bets.
Sippd

Find JavaScript Jobs with Hired â€” Create a profile on Hired to connect with hiring managers at growing startups and Fortune 500 companies. It's free forÂ job-seekers.
Hired

ğŸ“–Â Tutorials, Opinions & Stories

The Unexpected Return of JS for Automation on macOS â€” A long time Mac expert reflects on what JavaScript offers folks who want to automate macOS versus AppleScript or Python before digging some of what you canÂ do.

Armin Briegel

Introducing Svelte, and Comparing Svelte with React and Vue â€” If Svelte isnâ€™t new to you, keep scrolling. But if youâ€™re unsure what itâ€™s about, this is a reasonable explanation of why you might use it and the basicÂ experience.

Josh Collinsworth

How JavaScript Engines Achieve Great Performance â€” If youâ€™ve ever wondered what it is browsers actually do to get JavaScript to execute quickly, this post digs into it aÂ little.

Robin Heggelund Hansen

Notification Systems 2.0: Part 2 - Scale & Reliability

Courier sponsor

Using WebAssembly (Created in Rust) for Fast React Components â€” Just how easy is it to integrate Rust into a standard React workflow? Josh takes a look. This may seem a real meeting of buzzwords, but ideas like this have a way of turning into theÂ future..

Josh Finnie

Useful React Hooks That You Can Use In Your Projects
Ifeanyi Dike (Smashing Magazine)

Volta vs. nvm for JavaScript Tooling
Jon Surrell

Why IndexedDB Is Slow and What to Use Instead
RxDB Documentation

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

Polly 5.2: Record, Replay, and Stub HTTP Interactions â€” Works in both Node and the browser and gives you a lot of control over recording, replaying and intercepting HTTP requests made from your testÂ suites.

Netflix, Inc.

Fiddle: The Easiest Way to Get Started with Electron â€” If youâ€™ve wanted to play with Electron for building a JavaScript-powered desktop app but didnâ€™t have the time, Fiddle makes it into more of a quick-start â€˜playgroundâ€™ experience.

Electron

Breakpoints and console.log Is the Past, Time Travel Is the Future â€” Test your code without leaving your editor, results display right next to your code and update immediately as youÂ type.

Quokka.js sponsor

reading-time: Reading Time Estimation for the Web â€” Feed it some text and itâ€™ll give you some basic estimates (e.g. â€˜7 minÂ readâ€™).

Nicolas Gryman

file-type: Detect the File Type of a Buffer, Uint8Array, or ArrayBuffer â€” For example, give it the raw data from a PNG file, and itâ€™ll tell you itâ€™s a PNGÂ file.

Sindre Sorhus

PickBetterPack: Discover Similar Packages from package.json Dependencies â€” Paste a package.json and this tool will show you a tree-like view with similar options for each dependency listed. A mixed bag, but an interestingÂ idea.

PickBetterPack

Tried. Tested. Trusted. Studio 3T - Power Tools for MongoDB â€” Intuitive IntelliShell. Generate JavaScript from queries. Reshape data with Reschema. Try Studio 3T free for 30Â days.

Studio 3T sponsor

use-prosemirror: Use the ProseMirror Editor in React Easily â€” ProseMirror is a popular toolkit for building rich textÂ editors.

Dmitry Minkovsky

Color 4: A Color Conversion and Manipulation Library â€” Immutable color conversion and manipulation with support for CSS colorÂ strings.

Qix

React Image Crop: A Responsive Image Cropping Tool
Dominic Tobias

ğŸµÂ Last but not least...

Elementary Grid: A JS + Elementary Powered Music Creator â€” Attempt to be the next deadmau5 with this JavaScript powered grid music creator.. or at least have a fun 30 seconds. Elementary is a toolkit we covered earlier this year that presents a new way to build audio software inÂ JavaScript.

Johan Althoff

items.title: Etsy's journey to TypeScript
items.content:
#â€‹565 â€” November 19, 2021

UnsubscribeÂ Â |Â Â Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

Understanding Why a Build Got 15x Slower with Webpack 5 â€” Two engineers began to encounter their front-end build process taking minutes rather than seconds and wondered what was up. This is their brief yet technical explanation of how they debugged it and how Webpack got aÂ fix.

Eoin Hennessy (Tines)

Etsyâ€™s Journey to TypeScript â€” These sorts of stories always seem to be popular as teams weigh up the best way to progress. Etsy had a lot of JavaScript code but felt some of the problems they were encountering could be solved by TypeScript. This post digs into the approach they took and â€œwhat it took to educate an Etsy-sized company in a new programmingÂ languageâ€.

Salem Hilal

Video API Built to Create Stunning Visual Experiences â€” Are videos impacting your page's load time? Now, deliver optimized videos in the right format, quality & size based on the user's device in real-time. Delivering stunning visual experiences just got simpler, Try ImageKit's forever-free planÂ today.

ImageKit.io sponsor

Some Notes on Using 'esbuild' â€” Julia Evansâ€™ walk into the world of JavaScript bundling will be of immediate interest to anyone whoâ€™s been doing JavaScript since pre-bundling times, and it digs well into how an experienced developer unfamiliar with esbuild interprets what itÂ reallyÂ does.

Julia Evans

TypeScript 4.5 Released â€” Just two weeks after the RC comes the final release. Whatâ€™s new? The formerly promised ES module support for Node is now merely experimental and in nightly releases only, but you also get the Awaited type, tail recursion elimination on conditional types, and naturally much more.

Daniel Rosenwasser (Microsoft)

React 18 Enters Beta Stage â€” ..but as the official Twitter account explains in a thread: â€œMost developers donâ€™t need to think about React 18 yet..â€ while noting they're keen for people to try it out and leave feedback on the issue tracker. The final release is due in Q1 2022.

React Working Group

IN BRIEF:

  • Kent C Dodds has joined the Remix team â€“ Remix is a promising looking framework being unveiled as open source next Monday (you can learn more of what it's about here).

  • If you're into (or interested) in serverless platforms, Cloudflare Workers has had a huge week with a beta of v2 of its popular Wrangler developer tools, its Durable Objects storage system going GA, and a new Services abstraction to easier build composable apps. Oh, and Workers now supports ES modules too.

  • The main npm registry, now run by GitHub, had a big security flaw where attackers had the theoretical potential to 'publish new versions of any npm package' without proper authorization. Ouch.

  • Ember 4.0 has been released.. maybe: it's not on their official blog or Twitter yet. More info on their v4 process here.

  • Netlify has raised $105M to double down on the Jamstack ecosystem and, hopefully, to increase Cassidy Williams' whimsy budget ğŸ˜Š

RELEASES:

Tagify 4.9 â€“ Elegant input component for tags.
Vuetify 2.6 â€“ Material Component Framework for Vue.
execa 6.0 â€“ A better Node process launcher.
Plottable 3.12.0 â€“ Modular chart components on D3.
Teaful 0.8 â€“ Tiny React state library.
Dann.js 2.4 â€“ Neural network library.
Electron.js 16

ğŸ’» Jobs

JavaScript Developer at X-Team (Remote) â€” Join the most energizing community for developers and work on long-term projects for Riot Games, FOX, Sony, Coinbase, andÂ more.
X-Team

Mid/Senior Software Engineer at Carbon Five (LA / SF / NYC / CHA) â€” Join our team of creative full-stack devs to work with exciting clients in tech. Great benefits, growth opps, caring team &Â more.
Carbon Five

Find JavaScript Jobs with Hired â€” Create a profile on Hired to connect with hiring managers at growing startups and Fortune 500 companies. It's free forÂ job-seekers.
Hired

ğŸ“–Â Tutorials, Opinions & Stories

How to Build Stunning 3D Scenes with React Three Fiber â€” If you want to build neat 3D visualizations in the browser using the React concepts youâ€™re already familiar with, hereâ€™s how to get started. A greatÂ intro.

Varun Vachhar

Powerful Command Line Tools for Modern Web Development â€” Whatâ€™s your favorite command-line tool? In this post, Louis shares a collection of relevant command-line apps and utilities that he has personally come across in the past fewÂ years.

Louis Lazaris

Migrating from Puppeteer to Playwright â€” Puppeteer is a popular Node library to remote control Chrome/Chromium browsers, whereas Playwright is a little broader and newer. This post digs through what you need to consider if you switch between theÂ two.

Checkly

Develop a Faster Way to Work. Build Internal Tools, Remarkably Fast â€” Custom dashboards, admin panels, CRUD appsâ€”build any internal tool faster in Retool. Get started for freeÂ today.

Retool sponsor

Using Web Workers to Boost Third-Party Script Performance â€” A look at Partytown, a still experimental library that aims to improve third-party script performance using Web WorkerÂ technology.

Arek Nawo

How to Debounce and Throttle Callbacks in Vue â€” How to debounce and throttle watchers and event handlers in VueÂ components.

Dmitri Pavlutin

Detecting Objects with Serverless, Twilio Video, and TensorFlow.js
Lizzie Siegle (Twilio)

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

Dexie.js 3.2: The IndexedDB Wrapper is Now Reactive â€” Dexie provides a well thought out wrapper around the IndexedDB API offered by most mainstream browsers and now it integrates even better with reactive UI libraries too. The homepage has had a facelift too and includes framework specificÂ examples.

David Fahlander

Electron 16.0.0 Released â€” Electron, the toolkit for building cross platform desktop apps with JavaScript, is now one of those projects with a fast, regular release cadence, so no huge changes here, but you get Chrome 96, Node 16.9.1 and V8 9.6 support, as well as the WebHIDÂ API.

OpenJS Foundation

App Performance Blocked By Your Database? â€” PolyScale provides a plug-and-play database edge cache. Scale globally in minutes without writingÂ code.

PolyScale.ai sponsor

MicroDiff: Lightweight, No Dependency Object and Array Comparison â€” Given two objects or arrays, it returns the differences. Boasts high performance and TypeScriptÂ support.

AsyncBanana

React Location: A New 'Enterprise-Grade' React App Router â€” An effort which got its start â€œas a wrapper around the long-winded [React Router] v6 beta releaseâ€ has spun off as a standalone project of its own.

Tanner Linsley

browser-or-node 2.0: Figure Out Where Your Code is Running â€” Provides a simple way to tell if your code is currently running in a browser, in Node, in a Web Worker, or inÂ Deno.

Dinesh Pandiyan

Free Activity Feeds & Chat APIs for Qualifying Teams

Stream sponsor

Geodesy Functions Implemented in JavaScript v2.3.0 â€” Geodesy is the science of measuring the earth, its shape, distances, etc. If you have a need to work with such concepts, these examples will beÂ useful.

Chris Veness

Î¼Plot 1.6: Fast, Tiny, Canvas-Based Time Series Chart Library
Leon Sorokin

items.title: 'Moving more and more into a post-React world.'
items.content:
#â€‹564 â€” November 12, 2021

UnsubscribeÂ Â |Â Â Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

'Rust is the Future of JavaScript Infrastructure' â€” Itâ€™s an opinion but the growing evidence is compelling. Rust (as well as Go) is now being heavily used to replace parts of the JavaScript tooling ecosystem that might have otherwise been written in JavaScript before (e.g. Rome, SWC, dprint).

Lee Robinson

Airbnb's Extensive JavaScript Style Guide â€” Itâ€™s been a few years since we mentioned this hugely popular, opinionated style guide, but it continues to get frequent updates/fixes and the first major update (v19) in two years has just beenÂ tagged.

Airbnb

Manage the Stability of Your Electron Apps withÂ Bugsnag â€” Capture JavaScript and native errors with end-to-end error reporting and diagnostics to fix the errors that matter and streamline user experience. LearnÂ more.

Bugsnag sponsor

Vercel Hires Rich Harris, Creator of Svelte â€” â€˜Person gets jobâ€™ isnâ€™t the most obviously interesting story out there, but when itâ€™s the creator of Svelte (and someone who has â–¶ï¸ lots of great insights on how webapps should be built) joining a platform that will enable him to focus even more strongly on the project, itâ€™s exciting as Rich himselfÂ says.

Guillermo Rauch

â€œNow that Svelte has full-time engineering resources, itâ€™s exciting to see accumulating evidence that things are moving more and more into a post-React world.â€

___
Zach Leatherman (creator of Eleventy)

Bundle Scanner: Identify npm Libraries Used on a Web Page â€” Enter a URL and this tool will try and show you what npm packages were used in the pageâ€™s JavaScript even if theyâ€™re all bundled up. Thereâ€™s an explanation of how it works. Or some example results for Kent C Doddâ€™s fancy new homepage.

Markus Englund

ğŸ“† Â JavaScript Marathon: A Week of Free Online Courses/Talks â€” Between November 15-19 (thatâ€™s next Monday to Friday), several JavaScript developers are giving online workshops on things like NgRx, GraphQL, XState, andÂ Vite.

This Dot Labs

RELEASES:

RxDB 10.4 â€“ Realtime database for JS apps.
Cypress 9.0 â€“ Test framework for anything browser-based.
Deno 1.16 â€“ It's definitely not Node.
Intro.js 4.3 â€“ User onboarding UI library.
htmlparser2 v7.2 â€“ Forgiving HTML and XML parser.
React Router v6
Angular DevTools 1.0.4

ğŸ’» Jobs

Backend Engineer (Remote, EU Timezones) â€” Weâ€™ve built a product thousands of people love (See Trustpilot if you donâ€™t believe us). We need your help with Node &Â TypeScript.
Feather

Software Engineer at Carbon Five (LA / SF / NYC / CHA) â€” Hiring full-stack developers at all levels to join our team of creative consultants. New tech, great clients, growth opps &Â more.
Carbon Five

Find JavaScript Jobs with Hired â€” Create a profile on Hired to connect with hiring managers at growing startups and Fortune 500 companies. It's free forÂ job-seekers.
Hired

ğŸ“–Â Tutorials, Opinions & Stories

The Invisible JavaScript Backdoor â€” Itâ€™s one thing if you can read some code to discover sneaky backdoors, but what if the code looks totally fine, yet really itâ€™s not? Invisible Unicode characters make it possible as we see (or not) here. One mitigation against this is to have your editor highlight such troublesome characters such as with the Gremlins extension for VS Code or SublimeÂ Text.

Wolfgang Ettlinger

Developer-First Infrastructure Using JavaScript and Pulumi â€” Build, deploy, and manage modern cloud applications and infrastructure using JavaScript. Get started forÂ free.

Pulumi sponsor

How to Toggle Dark Mode on a Page with a (Literal) Blink â€” Itâ€™s arguable how useful this specific use case for Tensorflow.js is, but itâ€™s interesting, works quite well (for me.. even with glasses on), and could lead you on to otherÂ things.

Ankur Kedia

Earning $1.5M in Revenue from a JavaScript Component â€” I know some of you love the occasional entrepreneurial story and maybe Marcin Warpechowski of Handsontable will inspire you withÂ his.

Indie Hackers

Node-RED in Industrial IoT: A Growing Standard â€” Node-RED is a long standing Node.js-based â€˜low codeâ€™ environment where you wire components together and itâ€™s taking on established commercial systems in the industrialÂ world.

United Manufacturing Hub

Beyond onClick: Handling Events in React

Lightstep sponsor

How to Speed Up Your TypeScript Monorepo with esbuild
Matteo Mazzarolo

Localizing Your Next.js App: The Basics
Ãtila Fassina

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

Splide: Lightweight and Accessible Slider/Carousel â€” Itâ€™s nice to see a clean, modern spin on the often maligned UI element. The homepage is packed with demos too. No dependencies, written in TypeScript, and boasts a clean report from Lighthouse. GitHubÂ repo.

Naotoshi Fujita

Vuestic 1.3.0: A Free and Open Source UI Library for Vue 3 â€” Some data tables have been added, along with a timeÂ picker.

Epicmax

Liqe: Lightweight Lucene-like Parser and Search Engine â€” Lets you use Lucene-style search query syntax to query or test things you have in JavaScript objects. InterestingÂ idea.

Gajus Kuizinas

Tried. Tested. Trusted. Studio 3T - Power Tools for MongoDB â€” Intuitive IntelliShell. Generate JavaScript from queries. Reshape data with Reschema. Try Studio 3T free for 30Â days.

Studio 3T sponsor

MiniMasonry.js: Minimalist Dependancy Free Masonry LayoutÂ Library â€” â€˜Masonryâ€™ layouts are where you get a wall-style effect on pages with elements laid out in strictly defined columns (or rows, sometimes).

Spope

Meet Hydrogen: Shopify's React Framework for Dynamic, Contextual and Personalized E-Commerce â€” Hydrogen is an in-development React framework bringing tech like Server Components and Vite into play for building custom stores on Shopify's ecommerceÂ platform.

Ilya Grigorik (Shopify)

Bree 7.0: A Versatile Job Scheduler for Node â€” Supports cron, dates, ms, later, and human-friendly for scheduling things. Made to help run Forward Email. GitHubÂ repo.

Nick Baugh

hashids.js: Small Library to Generate YouTube Style IDs fromÂ Numbers â€” If you donâ€™t want to expose numeric IDs to end users, this is an interestingÂ option.

Bazyli BrzÃ³ska

Vant: 65+ Lightweight Mobile UI Components Built with Vue andÂ TypeScript
youzan

#â€‹564 â€” November 12, 2021


UnsubscribeÂ Â |Â Â Read on the Web



JavaScript Weekly




  





  
  
'Rust is the Future of JavaScript Infrastructure' â€” Itâ€™s an opinion but the growing evidence is compelling. Rust (as well as Go) is now being heavily used to replace parts of the JavaScript tooling ecosystem that might have otherwise been written in JavaScript before (e.g. Rome, SWC, dprint).
Lee Robinson 


  
  
Airbnb's Extensive JavaScript Style Guide â€” Itâ€™s been a few years since we mentioned this hugely popular, opinionated style guide, but it continues to get frequent updates/fixes and the first major update (v19) in two years has just beenÂ tagged.
Airbnb 


  
  
Manage the Stability of Your Electron Apps withÂ Bugsnag â€” Capture JavaScript and native errors with end-to-end error reporting and diagnostics to fix the errors that matter and streamline user experience. LearnÂ more.

items.title: Angular 13, V8 9.7, and Puppeteer 11
items.content:
#â€‹563 â€” November 5, 2021

UnsubscribeÂ Â |Â Â Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

Chrome's New Feature to Record and Replay User Flows â€” Itâ€™s only a preview feature in Canary builds right now, but Chrome is adding a new Recorder panel to its DevTools which lets you record and replay a string of actions on a page (including under simulated slow network conditions). You can also measure the flow and get a performance trace forÂ analysis.

Jecelyn Yeen (Google)

Angular 13 Released â€” Despite sentiment on social media, Angular continues to be a hugely popular framework, particularly in enterprise situations and v13 continues to push things forward with more of the Ivy related improvements comingÂ through.

Mark Thompson

Another Bug Bites the Dust â€” AppSignal is an easy-to-use error and performance monitoring tool. We support the most popular Node.js frameworks and packages out-of-the-box. All features are included in all plans. Start a trial and send us your address for a box of DutchÂ cookies.

AppSignal sponsor

Microsoft Brings (More) JavaScript to Excel â€” At its latest Ignite conference, Microsoft unveiled an Excel update (currently in â€˜previewâ€™) that introduces a new JavaScript API for creating custom data types and functions based on them. More detailsÂ here.

TechCrunch

Announcing TypeScript 4.5 RC â€” The first release candidate of TypeScript 4.5 is here with no changes now expected before the final release. Weâ€™ll focus more on the final release but a big change with this RC is deferring the promised ESM support forÂ Node.js.

Daniel Rosenwasser and the TypeScript Team

QUICK BITS:

  • The V8 team has created the V8 v9.7 branch which introduces two new Array methods (findLast and findLastIndex) without needing a flag.

  • Two more npm packages have had malicious code injected by hijackers, this time it's coa and rc, both of which get millions of downloads per week.

  • Jeremy Wagner has written and now published, with A Book Apart, a new book called ResponsibleÂ JavaScript.

  • Nat Friedman, who has been a fantastic steward and CEO for GitHub since its acquisition by Microsoft, is moving on and handing the reins over to ThomasÂ Dohmke.

  • Talking of GitHub, if you fancy building a game in JavaScript consider joining their Game Off 2021 event â€“ you get till December 1 to submit an entry.

RELEASES:

Visual Studio Code (October) â€“ Light on JS updates this time.
axios-hooks 3.0 â€“ React hooks for Axios.
Recoil 0.5.0 â€“ Experimental React state management library.
Marked 4.0 â€“ Markdown parser and compiler.
jqGrid 5.6 â€“ jQuery tabular data grid plugin.
Rollup 2.59.0 â€“ ES module bundler.
Puppeteer 11 â€“ Headless Chrome Node.js API.

ğŸ’» Jobs

JavaScript Developer at X-Team (Remote) â€” Join the most energizing community for developers and work on long-term projects for Riot Games, FOX, Sony, Coinbase, andÂ more.
X-Team

Software Engineer â€” Join our "kick ass" team. Our software team operates from 17 countries and we're always looking for more exceptionalÂ engineers.
Sticker Mule

Find JavaScript Jobs with Hired â€” Create a profile on Hired to connect with hiring managers at growing startups and Fortune 500 companies. It's free forÂ job-seekers.
Hired

ğŸ“–Â Tutorials, Opinions & Stories

â–¶Â Â Have Single-Page Apps Ruined the Web? â€” The creator of frontend framework Svelte talks about the criticisms lodged towards single-page apps and how â€˜transitional appsâ€™ may be the wayÂ forward. Lots of good insights here that will probably make you feel a bit smarterÂ afterwardÂ too.

Rich Harris

Developer Tools Secrets That Shouldnâ€™t Be Secrets â€” An Edge-focused look at console power tips, how to use browser developer tools outside the browser, andÂ more.

Christian Heilmann

Visualizing Time Series Data with the Highcharts Library and InfluxDB â€” Learn how to use Highcharts library to understand and act on IoT data in this hands-onÂ tutorial.

InfluxData sponsor

Creating the Effect of Transparent Glass and Plastic with Three.js â€” The effects you can pull off in the browser nowadays continue to impress me as someone who grew up on 8-bit graphics(!) ;-)

Kelly Milligan

How to Show/Hide Elements in Vue â€” How to use v-if, v-show and :class to show/hide elements inÂ Vue.

Dmitri Pavlutin

â–¶Â Â What is Astro? â€” Drew McLellan talks to developer Matthew Phillips about the modern static site builder.

Smashing Podcast podcast

Best Practices for Embedding Third-Party Web Widgets
Ravidu Perera

Proxying Third-Party JavaScript as First-Party JavaScript (and the Potential Effect onÂ Analytics)
Chris Coyier

How to Deploy a Vue.js 3 App on Azure Static Web Apps
Obinna Odirionye

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

Hasty: A JavaScript Snippet Perfomance Comparison Tool â€” A quick, easy-to-use online tool that lets you test variations of a particular snippet to see which one performs best. A bit like jsPerf from the oldÂ day, or other tools like perf.link andÂ jsBench.

Mads Cordes

Coding Font: A 'Game' to Find Your New Favorite Code Font â€” This is a fun idea. It throws over 25 popular developer-oriented fonts into a â€˜tournamentâ€™ and you then pick your favorites until youâ€™re left with a winner. (It was JetBrains Mono forÂ me.)

Typogram

Dynamic Charts Based on Data Selection in Angular â€” Ever had users asking to be able to generate their own charts? This tutorial shows you how easy it can be with Kendo UI forÂ Angular.

Progress Kendo UI for Angular sponsor

History: An API to Manage Session History with JavaScript â€” The getting started docs give a great look at why and where youâ€™d useÂ this.

Remix

Depp: Check npm Modules for Unused and Duplicate DependenciesÂ Fast â€” A new Go-powered tool you run from your JavaScript/TypeScript projectâ€™s folder to look for unusedÂ dependencies.

Rahul Tarak

Prisma 3.4.0 Released: The Popular 'Next Gen' ORM and Toolset â€” PostgreSQL 14 support is a key feature, plus support for using orderBy with aggregate groups in MongoDB, as well as the usual tweaks and bugÂ fixes.

Prisma

Smooth Scrollbar: Flexible, Customizable Scrollbars â€” I quite like that it advises you not to use it unless â€œyou know what you are doingâ€ â€“ good advice considering how it can make navigating a page â€˜feelâ€™ different. Try the demoÂ page.

Daofeng Wu

Catch Errors in Your Complex Regular Expressions with SonarLint

SonarLint sponsor

A Script to Export Photoshop Layers to Individual Files Fast â€” This caught my interest as Iâ€™ve done some scripting in Adobe apps before. It uses an unusual dialect of ECMAScript called â€˜ExtendScriptâ€™ (hence the confusing .jsx extension on the scripts) but you can get a lot done with it, as demonstratedÂ here.

Hanna

Detox: 'Gray Box' End-to-End Testing and Automation Framework for Mobile Apps â€” Tests your mobile app while itâ€™s running in a real device/simulator, interacting with it just like a real user â€“ you write the scripts inÂ JavaScript.

Wix

CachedLookup: A Simple Package to Cache and Save on Expensive API Calls
Kartik

title: JavaScript Weekly
description: A newsletter of JavaScript articles, news and cool projects
